reviews.review_msg: A very competent, fair, and highly knowledgeable professor. I have taken two classes with her, and both classes were very engaging. If I could find a way to get into all her classes I definitely would. Thank you Dr Gulnaz!

Gulnaz is my favorite professor at SFU even though she is among the new professors! Her teaching is densely packed with a lot of information and everything is really well explained. Her grading is slightly tough but she is a fair grader.

Prof. Anjum was a great professor for this course. Her lectures were interesting but very long. If you sign up for this course then get ready to know a lot about cross-cultural research and long intense lectures in all classes.
Awful prof. Lecture is straight from the textbook and slides are snippets of the textbook. Not organized and forgets to record lectures. Do not recommend and avoid at all costs if you can!
I don't understand the hype about Professor Grime because honestly you don't learn anything new in her classes.

Simply Awful. His lectures are dull and unclear. His quizzes/exams are extremely poorly worded and confusing. If you take this class, the textbook will be your best friend, as it is the best thing this class has to offer.

You will be penalized for doing well. The whole class did better than expected so he knocked us all down a few grades. I should have gotten a B but got a C+ instead even though the B is the grade I earned.

Do not take Mathew. His lectures were disorganized and dry as he turned mildly interesting material into something incomprehensible. Overall the class was easy, however it was poorly structured and everyone got curved down, a 92 turned into a B+. The class was not worth the effort.
